item.title: Darleen add a quote by Walter Winchell
item.description: "A friend is one who walks in when others walk out." -- Walter Winchell

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Women and cats will do as they please, and men and dogs should relax and get used to the idea." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All women become like their mothers. That is their tragedy. No man does, and that is his." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Why are women... so much more interesting to men than men are to women?" -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Abigail Padgett
item.description: "The way black women say "girl" can be magical. Frankly, I have no solid beliefs about the survival of consciousness after physical death. But if it's going to happen I know what I want to see after my trek toward the light. I want to see a black woman who will smile and say, "Girl...." -- Abigail Padgett

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Patricia Briggs
item.description: "I don't like it when I outweigh my men." -- Patricia Briggs

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Joseph Conrad
item.description: "Being a woman is a terribly difficult task, since it consists principally in dealing with men." -- Joseph Conrad

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Barbara Bush
item.description: "Clinton lied. A man might forget where he parks or where he lives, but he never forgets oral sex, no matter how bad it is." -- Barbara Bush

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "Sex is an emotion in motion." -- Mae West

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Joan Rivers
item.description: "A man can sleep around, no questions asked, but if a woman makes nineteen or twenty mistakes she's a tramp." -- Joan Rivers

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Leonardo da Vinci
item.description: "The function of muscle is to pull and not to push, except in the case of the genitals and the tongue." -- Leonardo da Vinci

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Lily Tomlin
item.description: "We have reason to believe that man first walked upright to free his hands for masturbation." -- Lily Tomlin

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Gemma Hatchback
item.description: "If a man is highly sexed he's virile. If a woman is, she's a nymphomaniac. With them it's power but with us it's a disease! Even the act of sex is called penetration! Why don't they call it enclosure?" -- Gemma Hatchback

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "I'm as pure as the driven slush." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Darleen add a quote by alice walker
item.description: "I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it." -- alice walker

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "I have three phobias which, could I mute them,would make my life as slick as a sonnet,but dull as ditch water:I hate to go to bed,I hate to get up and I hate to be alone..." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle." -- Plato

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naïve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Anaïs Nin
item.description: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are." -- Anaïs Nin

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Darleen add a quote by S.E. Hinton
item.description: "I lie to myself all the time. But I never believe me." -- S.E. Hinton

item.title: Darleen add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description:
"Books let us into their souls and lay open to us the secrets of our own."
[<i>The Sick Chamber</i> (<i>The New Monthly Magazine </i>, August 1830)]" -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Darleen add a quote by William Hazlitt
item.description: "Man is the only animal that laughs and weeps; for he is the only animal that is struck with the difference between what things are, and what they ought to be." -- William Hazlitt

item.title: Darleen add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou
